column4: Hi everyone. Is anyone familiar with a guide to completely eliminate pulseaudio and use pure alsa in ubuntu 10.10?
probably not a good idea actually
that's why i said probably not a good idea - it will kill "Ubuntu" sound.
i had an emulator that wouldn't work with Pulse installed too - i stopped using it.
but how can I solve the issue with xbmc otherwise? from what I understand, pulseaudio doesn't allow spdif passthrough audio.
have to tried starting xbmc with "padsp XBMC_BIN"? worth a shot.
i don't know what the xbmc binary is called - replace with the proper executable
what would that do? as it may already be obvious, I'm quite new to ubuntu and xbmc:)

yeah, just man'ed it. not sure it makes sense but is there a simila command with alsa?
